title: Bug 21834: Coolbar Deleting Items Corrupting Layout
description: The bug report highlights an issue where deleting items in a Coolbar causes corruption in the layout. The report is based on Build 2002071610021.
OB: The observed behavior is that when you press the Delete button, the first item on the second row is deleted. However, the 'Launch' item is moved to the first row when the deletion occurs. The expected behavior is that the 'Launch' item should remain on the second row.
EB: The expected behavior is that when an item is deleted from the Coolbar, the layout should remain intact. Specifically, deleting the first item on the second row should not affect the placement of other items on the Coolbar.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Run the attached test case.
2. Drag the 'Open Type' cool item to the second row (last cool item).
3. Drag the 'Launch' cool item (last cool item on the first row) to the second row, placing it after the 'Open Type' item.
4. Drag the 'Search' cool item to the second row, placing it after the 'Launch' cool item.
5. Drag the 'Script' cool item to the second row (last cool item on the first row), putting it after the 'Search' cool item.
6. Press the Delete button. This will delete the first item on the second row. Notice that the second row is removed when the deletion occurs. The second row should remain.

Additionally, another set of steps for reproduction is provided:
1. Run the attached test case.
2. Drag the 'Script' cool item to the second row.
3. Drag the 'Launch' cool item to the second row, putting it after the 'Script' item.
4. Drag the 'Search' cool item to the second row, putting it after the 'Launch' cool item.
5. Drag the 'Open Type' cool item to the second row, putting it after the 'Search' cool item.
